intro: Neobotrydium corniculatum, commonly known as the horned bladderwort, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures used for trapping tiny aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, nutrient-rich waters and is often found in temperate regions. Its leaves are usually submerged, while its flowers emerge above the water surface. Neobotrydium corniculatum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
